medical_history.chief_complaint: Multiple trichilemmal cysts arranged in a bandlike pattern with hyperkeratotic skin lesions.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Hyperkeratotic skin lesions since birth, with a linear arrangement on the face and right side of the body. At age 3, filiform hyperkeratoses began to emerge, followed by lump formation on the chest by age 5. Lumps increased in number and size over the years, leading to excisions due to inflammation and fistula formation.
medical_history.past_medical_history: At age 9, developed arthritis-like symptoms diagnosed as florid juvenile arthritis, treated with corticosteroids and NSAIDs. Severe osteomalacia with spontaneous fractures noted since age 17. Became wheelchair-bound by age 26 due to severe arthrosis and bowing of the legs.
medical_history.social_history: Reportedly had a limited diet primarily consisting of bread and meat; experienced significant weight loss over the last 10 to 15 years, weighing only 40 kg at the time of presentation.
